intro: Fumana thymifolia subsp. juniperina, commonly known as Juniperleaf fumana, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive aromatic scent, often described as similar to juniper. Its flowers are small, white to pale yellow, and clustered in umbrella-like structures, typical of the carrot family. This subspecies is often found in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in well-drained, sunny environments.
